control.name: Mask sensitive data when the data is shown in the app
control.desc: Many apps require users to enter several kinds of data to, for example, register an account or make a payment. Sensitive data may be exposed if the app doesn't properly mask it, when displaying data in clear text. Masking of sensitive data, by showing asterisk or dots instead of clear text should be enforced within an app's activity to prevent disclosure and mitigate risks such as shoulder surfing.

reference.name: OWASP MASVS - Android - Testing for Sensitive Data Disclosure Through the User Interface
OWASP MASVS - iOS - Testing for Sensitive Data Disclosure Through the User Interface

test.steps: Check that when you introduce sensitive data into the app such as passwords or PIN, this information is masked.
